department_name: Community Development Agency - Environmental Health Services

grading_system.description: Marin County conducts food facility inspections but specific grading/scoring methodology not found in public sources

inspection_details.frequency: Risk-based frequency as required by California Retail Food Code
inspection_details.reinspection_trigger: Violations found during routine inspection or complaints
inspection_details.public_disclosure: Food facility inspections are searchable through online portal and open data portal

facility_safety_authority.department_name: Southern Marin Fire Protection District and other local fire departments
facility_safety_authority.ansul_system_requirements: ANSUL-style suppression systems required for commercial kitchens, with semi-annual inspections every 6 months per NFPA 96. Systems must undergo AHJ acceptance testing by fire marshal before approval.
facility_safety_authority.inspection_frequency: Semi-annual (every 6 months) for kitchen fire suppression systems

regulatory_framework.state_vs_local_authority: County Environmental Health Services conducts inspections for all retail food facilities in Marin County
regulatory_framework.local_ordinances: Reusable foodware ordinance, compostable plates/cups requirements

confidence_notes: Clear information found on inspection authority (county Environmental Health Services), food code basis (California Retail Food Code), and fire safety requirements. However, specific grading/scoring methodology not documented in publicly available sources.
verification_notes: Must verify specific grading system used by Marin County Environmental Health Services - whether they use letter grades (A/B/C), numerical scores (0-100), pass/fail, or another methodology. Also need to confirm specific inspection frequencies and risk categories used.
